p:
Here, we demonstrate that by jointly analyzing serological results for both MAYV and CHIKV alongside data on the age and location of participants, we can simultaneously reconstruct the history of circulation of the viruses and the extent of cross-reactivity. We apply our approach to MAYV and CHIKV in French Guiana, a territory that has seen a CHIKV epidemic between February 2014 and October 2015
13– 15 , as well as documented MAYV cases
16, 17 . We randomly collected 2697 population-representative serum samples from all age-groups from throughout French Guiana
18 (Methods and Supplementary Table 1). For each serum sample, we measured antibody responses to both MAYV and CHIKV using a multiplexed microsphere-based IgG immunoassay (MIA) that returned a relative fluorescence intensity (RFI) for each pathogen
19 (see Methods section).
